results.title: Helicopter management: fire
results.brief_description: The helicopter is widely used in all phases of forest fire control in America. This training film is designed to assist personnel in planning, organising and directing helicopter operations safely and efficiently.

results.title: Helicopter Canada
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Peter Jones, Eugene Boyko, Donald Brittain and Derek May
results.brief_description: A helicopter was used throughout this exploration of the ten provinces. The result of this off-the-ground portraiture is a view that is big, beautiful, and continuously engrossing. Nothing here is quite the same as seen before, even Niagara Falls. Canadians will be thrilled by this Panavision view of familiar territory. The ‘Beatles’ appear briefly in a limousine. Made for international distribution for the Canadian centennial. Written by Donald Brittain and Derek May. Narrated by Stanley Jackson. Edited by Rex Tasker.

results.title: Helen Keller in her story
results.creator_credit: Butterfield and Wolf Inc, Richard Carver Wood and Nancy Hamilton
results.brief_description: This inspiring film received an Academy Award for the best feature documentary of 1956, A biography of Helen Keller, it traces her life from her birth to her mid seventies - when this documentary was made. As a small child, she was left totally blind and deaf by an illness. For years she was cut off from the rest of the world, until Ann Sullivan taught her to read braille, read lips and talk. This film shows excerpts from the silent docudrama: “Deliverance” in which she starred. Also contains the only newsreel footage of Ann Sullivan. Narrated by Katherine Cornell. Music by Morgan Lewis.

results.title: Helen Keller
results.creator_credit: David L. Wolper and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The story of Helen Keller is the story of a normal child who, at the age of 18 months, was suddenly shut off from the world but, against overwhelming odds, waged a slow, hard but successful battle to re-enter that same world. The child grew into a highly intelligent and sensitive woman who wrote, spoke and labored incessantly for the betterment of others. Helen was born in Tuscumbia, Alabama on June 27, 1880. However, her real life began one day in March of 1887, when she was almost seven years old. She was always to call that the most important day I can remember in my life. It was the day when Annie Sullivan, a 20 year old graduate of the Perkins School for the Blind, came to be her teacher. They were inseparable until Annies death in 1936. This Film depicts events in her life, who, with the aid of her teacher, learned to understand and communicate with others.

results.title: Helen's war: Portrait of a dissident
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Sonja Armstrong Productions, Reel to Reel Productions, Sonja Armstrong, Anne Pick and Anna Broinowski
results.brief_description: A moving documentary about one woman’s anti-nuclear crusade that has her challenging the very fabric of American society - but she’s an Australian. A qualified medical doctor, Helen Caldicott has been a peace activist for the last twenty years. Her cynical filmmaking niece, Anna Broinowski, goes on the road with her aunt for a year to document and sometimes challenge Dr Caldicott. Helen’s predictions of the use of missiles on the people of Iraq become true and she is more determined to fight the good fight, particularly post 9/11. Her public speaking is something to behold and the reactions she receives, either enraging people or moving them to empathetic tears is powerful stuff. An Australian/Canadian co-production.

results.title: Heki-un-so and Kyoto
results.brief_description: A visit to the ancient city of Kyoto which is the cradle of ten centureis of history and tradition. Shows the beautiful Heki-un-so gardens, created in the traditional Japanese style, during the four seasons of the year, as well as many examples of ancient and modern Japanese buildings, a tea ceremony and many ceremonies and festivals which are part of the way of life in this ancient capital city of Japan.

results.title: Heidi Di Santo's guide to relaxation
results.brief_description: Heidi Di Santo teaches a relaxation technique to assist with combating stress in the workplace. Stress is something which affects the productivity of most workplaces, and this video offers suggestions on how to minimize the stress and increase productivity.

results.title: Heidi
results.creator_credit: Darryl F. Zanuck, Allan Dwan and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple portrays the spirited young heroine of Johanna Spyri’s popular children’s novel giving her rich emotion and infinte charm. When her Aunt tires of caring for her, orphan Heidi is taken to the Swiss mountains to live with her gruff grandfather (Jean Hersholt), a hermit who comes to adore her. However, the Aunt returns to steal Heidi and sells her to a family whose invalid daughter (Marcia Mae Jones) needs a companion. Bullied by an evil governess (Mary Nash), Heidi still charms the entire household and never stops trying to return to her beloved grandfather. Colourised version.
